page.title: 13Housing in the area.
page.content: The square is basically a suburban residential area.There is a mixture of housing types ranging from old people's flats to detached houses and from 17th Century houses to the most modern of designs. Some houses are council owned and others are owner occupied. The St.Helier Estate was built in the 1930's and was originally the largest council owned estate in the country.Tenants are now starting to buy their houses from the council and the are modernising them by adding porches, extensions and garages where possible.The council have recently put in new windows and added bathrooms. A small survey of 21 people showed there was a variation in the length of residence, with 7 people having lived in their houses for over 20 years. New developments of private housing are being built in the square.
